headline: Nvidia–xAI boosts chip stocks, Equifax strikes back against FICO
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman outlines three of Wednesday's top stories on Wall Street as part of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Chip stocks continue to rise on Bloomberg reports — now confirmed by Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang — that Nvidia is among the investors financing the latest funding round for Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk's artificial intelligence (AI) company, xAI (XAAI.PVT). Equifax (EFX) stock surges after the company cut its credit score data prices, striking back against FICO (FICO). AST Spacemobile (ASTS) stock skyrockets on news of the company's deal with Verizon (VZ). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Equifax (EFX) stock surges after the company cut its credit score data prices, striking back against FICO (FICO). headline: How Verizon Launched AST SpaceMobile Stock Into Space Today
summary: AST SpaceMobile  stock surged early Wednesday after the satellite operator announced a deal with  Verizon  to provide space-based cellular broadband services across the U.S.  The company, a rival to Elon Musk’s Starlink, said the commercial agreement would provide Verizon customers with a space-based cellular service starting in 2026, enabling them to stay connected “wherever they are, from hiking trails to city centers and everywhere in between.”  William Blair analyst Louie DiPalma said the deal was a “competitive win” for AST SpaceMobile over Starlink.

headline: Verizon-AST SpaceMobile partnership, Penguin Solutions stock falls
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Verizon Communications (VZ) inking a partnership with AST SpaceMobile (ASTS) to provide cell service from space, Penguin Solutions (PENG) shares falling in Wednesday's pre-market trading on its sales forecast, and Jefferies Financial Group (JEF) disclosing exposure to now-bankrupt auto parts manufacturer First Brands Group. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Verizon accelerates fixed wireless broadband expansion with acquisition of Starry
summary: Additional Fixed Wireless Access capabilities delivering more choice, value and flexibility for consumersKey Highlights: Starry is a fixed wireless broadband provider serving multi-dwelling units (MDUs) in five markets, including Boston, Denver, Los Angeles, New York and Washington, D.C.The MDU solution will accelerate Verizon’s plan to double its fixed wireless subscribers to 8-9 million by 2028 and expand fixed wireless broadband availability to 90 million households in the same time period.Ac

headline: Verizon teams up with AST SpaceMobile to provide cellular service from space
summary: Verizon has signed a deal to provide cellular service from space through AST SpaceMobile beginning next year.  Shares of AST SpaceMobile, a space-based cellular broadband network, soared more than 10% before the market opened Wednesday.  “The agreement will extend the scope of Verizon’s 850 MHz premium low-band spectrum into areas of the U.S. that would benefit from the ubiquitous reach of space-based broadband technology," Abel Avellan, founder, chairman and CEO of AST SpaceMobile, said in a statement.

raw.headline: Verizon teams up with AST SpaceMobile to provide cellular service from space

headline: AST SpaceMobile Announces Definitive Commercial Agreement with Verizon to Support Space-Based Cellular Broadband Across the Continental United States
summary: MIDLAND, Texas, October 08, 2025--AST SpaceMobile, Inc. ("AST SpaceMobile") (NASDAQ: ASTS), the company building the first and only space-based cellular broadband network accessible directly by everyday smartphones, designed for both commercial and government applications, today announced the signing of a definitive commercial agreement with Verizon (NYSE, NASDAQ: VZ) to provide direct-to-cellular AST SpaceMobile service when needed for Verizon customers starting in 2026. headline: Wall Street gets back to rising as gold keeps setting records
summary: U.S. stocks are getting back to rising on Wednesday, a day after breaking their seven-day winning streak, while the price of gold is pushing further past $4,000 per ounce.  The S&P 500 rose 0.4% and is on track to top its all-time high set on Monday.  Stocks have been drifting without them or other signals to alter expectations for continued cuts to interest rates by the Federal Reserve, one of the major reasons the stock market has surged since April.
